title: JSE Pushes to One-Month High
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 12 September 2019

The JSE pushed to a one-month high on Wednesday as investors remained optimistic over the prospect of fresh monetary stimulus. Shortly after the closing bell, the All Share was up by 1.87%US stocks traded higher on Wednesday after China suspended import tariffs on certain US goods, easing trade tensions. The was up by 0.39% shortly after the JSE closed.European shares surged to a six-week high on Wednesday amid easing trade tensions. Shortly after the JSE closed, the was up 0.96%, 40 rose to 0.44% and 30 ended 0.74% in the green.Hong Kong closed at a six-week high on Wednesday boosted by a stellar performance by the financial and property sectors amid easing trade tensions. The closed 1.78% in the green.Japanese shares surged on Wednesday as banks continued to benefit from an increase in government bond yields. The Index closed 0.96% in the green.The rand declined slightly against the dollar on Wednesday as local business confidence declined. Just after the JSE closed, the rand weakened to R14.47/$.Improved risk appetite boosted by hopes of economic stimulus from key central banks continued to lift the price of gold on Wednesday ahead of the European Central Bank’s (ECB) meeting. At 19h30, an ounce of traded at $1 495.53.US crude stocks plunged as Iraq confirmed that OPEC is contemplating further output cuts. At 19h45, a barrel of lost 3.01% and traded at $61.27.
description: Market Overview Analysis by Adriaan Pask covering: USD/ZAR, FTSE 100, XAU/USD, CAC 40. Read Adriaan Pask's latest article on Investing.com South Africa.
